attributes.action: give evidence to the Chilcot Enquiry before the general election.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown was Chancellor of the Exchequer at the time that the decision was made to support the American led invasion of Iraq. It is imperative that Gordon Brown was Chancellor of the Exchequer at the time that the decision was made to support the American led invasion of Iraq . It is imperative that Gordon Brown presents evidence to the Chilcot Enquiry before the General Election so that the public will have the opportunity to fully understand his involvement in the decision to go to war and the extent to which he rationed funds to the Armed Forces.

rejection.details: It is up to the independent inquiry committee to decide who they want to hear evidence from and when that evidence should be delivered. The PM can not choose when to give evidence.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
